TestDescription.name: Genericons DOM-based XSS vulnerability
TestDescription.Description: "Genericons are vector icons embedded in a webfont designed to be clean and simple keeping with a generic aesthetic." [break][break] The Genericons package includes a file called [dark][bold]example.html[/bold][/dark] which has been found to be vulnerable to a DOM-based XSS vulnerability. This package is included in various WordPress plugins and themes. For example is included in the TwentyFifteen theme (installed by default) and the very popular JetPack plugin.
TestDescription.Impact: Malicious users may inject JavaScript, VBScript, ActiveX, HTML or Flash into a vulnerable application to fool a user in order to gather data from them. An attacker can steal the session cookie and take over the account, impersonating the user. It is also possible to modify the content of the page presented to the user.
TestDescription.Recommendation: Remove the [dark][bold]example.html[/bold][/dark] file located in the genericons directory.

Reference.database: JetPack and TwentyFifteen Vulnerable to DOM-based XSS
